message: All metadata fields for the indicator 3-2-2, translated into en
data: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages3.2 By 2030, eliminate preventable deaths of infants and children under 5, with all countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to 12 per 1,000 live births or less and child mortality under 5 from 5 years to 25 per 1,000 live births at most3.2.2. Infant and child mortality rate2020ISTEEBUNDAYISENGA ModestDepartment of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODDHead of Service and Focal Point79401937ndayimode2010@gmail.comThis is the number of deaths per 100,000 live birthsEDSB-III, 2016-2017Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaireThe probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)In 2022ISTEEBUISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national levelISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.Ratio of the number of children under 5 who died to the total number of children under 5 per 100,000 live births during a given periodThe results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publicationThe indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (Total; Girls; Boys; Urban area; Rural area)The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international levelReport of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017
